title: Latency Question. ðŸ”§
body:
Hello.

I've noticed quite a bit, that LOL Replay 2, and now the new Lag Tool both represent my ping should be in the mid 50's, and I'm gathering that that's taking everything into consideration that the game also has t odeal with. Yet whilst I am in game, my ping is in the high 60's.

Just wondering what factors may be influencing the difference between my actual ping and the Tool's reported ping. I'm the only system/device on the network (lucky me) Have port forwarding set up, etc.

I did notice some time ago that alot of people with certain ISP's were having issues with connections, due to the 3rd party game do dad whatevers they use (or whatever they are) and the RIOT team did some "tweaking" as they called it to the way their servers handled those communications. During that time, my actual game ping was in the low 50's, but on the next patch cycle it shot straight back up into the high 60's, where it is now.

That leads me to believe that the difference in ping is a server side issue, maybe you could "re-tweak" the settings again :D

Anyway, cheers for listening to the rant. Have fun!

replies.body:
Hi Wukes, as expected my NBN on FTTN is much slower than FTTP, coupled with that there seems to be alot of copper mesh wiring in the house interfering with my 5GHZ, 80mhz AC network, so there is alot more jitter and packet loss than anticipated. At the moment at least once per 2 minutes I experience it and it's my side, I'm aware and looking at wiring a network into the house.

That aside, after step 6 and 7,

6    69 ms    71 ms    71 ms  203-221-3-69.tpgi.com.au [203.221.3.69] 
7    66 ms    66 ms    65 ms  203-219-106-254.tpgi.com.au [203.219.106.254] 

the request times out continuously, making the tracert file unfinishable but I will list here, with altered first 2 IPs to blank. Step 2 is the Perth server from what I am aware of.

1     1 ms     1 ms     1 ms  
2    11 ms    10 ms    11 ms  
3    66 ms    66 ms    66 ms  203-219-57-130.tpgi.com.au [203.219.57.130] 
4    64 ms    63 ms    63 ms  203-219-57-25.tpgi.com.au [203.219.57.25] 
5    73 ms    71 ms    71 ms  syd-gls-har-crt2-be-10.tpgi.com.au [202.7.173.17] 
6    69 ms    71 ms    71 ms  203-221-3-69.tpgi.com.au [203.221.3.69] 
7    66 ms    66 ms    65 ms  203-219-106-254.tpgi.com.au [203.219.106.254] 

So here are the new tracerts, 71 is the average ping I recieve now.

Again, apologies for the delay. Between setting up the new house and trying to wrap my head around the new LoL systems, I've been a touch distracted, but thank you kindly for the reminder :)
Hello, sorry been in the process of moving. Net is reconnected on Monday, and I'm going from NBN FTTP to FTTN.... I'll look to get it done then. Thanks man.

Hm, maybe we can try to figure out where that extra 20ms is coming from. Can you run a tracert to the Riot Games servers and copy/paste the results here?

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752674-Network-System-and-League-of-Legends-Logs#wq2

Thanks!
